development.c-development: These tools include core development tools such as automake, gcc and debuggers.

development.design-suite: These packages are targeted towards professional designers related to graphics, web and animation.

development.development-libs: The packages in this group are core libraries needed to develop applications.

development.development-tools: These tools include general development tools such as git and CVS.

development.eclipse: Integrated Development Environments based on Eclipse.

development.electronic-lab: Design and simulation tools for hardware engineers

development.fedora-packager: Tools and utilities needed by a Fedora Packager

development.font-design: This group is a collection of tools used in the design, modification, manipulation, and packaging of fonts.

development.gnome-software-development: Install these packages in order to develop GTK+ and GNOME graphical applications.

development.haskell: Support for developing programs in the Haskell programming language.

development.java-development: Support for developing programs in the Java programming language.

development.kde-software-development: Install these packages to develop Qt and KDE graphical applications.

development.kf5-software-development: Install these packages to develop applications using Qt5 and KDE Frameworks 5.

development.legacy-software-development: These packages provide compatibility with previous releases.

development.libreoffice-development: These packages are helpful when developing LibreOffice extensions or macros.

development.mingw32: Support for cross-compiling programs to 32 bit Windows targets, testing them, and building installers, all from within Fedora.

development.mysql: This package group contains packages useful for use with MariaDB (MySQL).

development.ocaml: Support for developing software using the Objective Caml programming language and libraries.

development.perl: Support for developing programs in the Perl programming language.

development.robotics-suite: Suite of packages for robotics development

development.rpm-development-tools: These tools include core development tools such rpmbuild.

development.ruby: Basic support for the Ruby programming language.

development.rubyonrails: Ruby on Rails web application stack.

development.sql-server: This package group includes packages useful for use with PostgreSQL.

development.virtualization: These packages provide a graphical virtualization environment.

development.web-server: These tools allow you to run a Web server on the system.

development.x-software-development: These packages allow you to develop applications for the X Window System.

development.xfce-software-development: Install these packages in order to develop GTK+ and Xfce graphical applications.

content.books: Books and Guides for Fedora users and developers

cinnamon-desktop.cinnamon-desktop: Cinnamon provides a desktop with a traditional layout, advanced features, easy to use, powerful and flexible.

mate-desktop.mate-compiz: This package group adds Compiz and Emerald to MATE desktop

mate-desktop.mate-desktop: MATE Desktop is based on GNOME 2 and provides a powerful graphical user interface for users who seek a simple easy to use traditional desktop interface.

gnome-desktop.gnome-desktop: GNOME is a highly intuitive and user friendly desktop environment.

gnome-desktop.gnome-games: A variety of games for the GNOME Desktop

kde-desktop.kde-apps: A set of commonly used KDE applications

kde-desktop.kde-desktop: The KDE Plasma Workspaces, a highly-configurable graphical user interface which includes a panel, desktop, system icons and desktop widgets, and many powerful KDE applications.

servers.dns-server: This package group allows you to run a DNS name server (BIND) on the system.

servers.freeipa-server: Provides central directory services for identity, policy management and auditing.

servers.ftp-server: These tools allow you to run an FTP server on the system.

servers.ha: Infrastructure for highly available services and/or shared storage.

servers.legacy-network-server: These packages include servers for old network protocols such as rsh and telnet.

servers.load-balancer: Load balancing support for network traffic

servers.mail-server: These packages allow you to configure an IMAP or SMTP mail server.

servers.mysql: This package group contains packages useful for use with MariaDB (MySQL).

servers.network-server: These packages include network-based servers such as DHCP, Kerberos and NIS.

servers.news-server: This group allows you to configure the system as a news server.

servers.printing: Install these tools to enable the system to print or act as a print server.

servers.rubyonrails: Ruby on Rails web application stack.

servers.server-cfg: This group contains all of Red Hat's custom server configuration tools.

servers.smb-server: This package group allows you to share files between Linux and MS Windows(tm) systems.

servers.sql-server: This package group includes packages useful for use with PostgreSQL.

servers.virtualization: These packages provide a graphical virtualization environment.

servers.web-server: These tools allow you to run a Web server on the system.

lxqt-desktop.lxqt-apps: A set of commonly used applications for the LXQt Desktop

lxqt-desktop.lxqt-desktop: LXQt is a lightweight X11 desktop environment designed for computers with low hardware specifications like netbooks, mobile devices or older computers.

applications.audio: Various tools for audio synthesis and music production.

applications.authoring-and-publishing: These tools allow you to create documents in the DocBook format and convert them into HTML, PDF, Postscript, and text.

applications.design-suite: These packages are targeted towards professional designers related to graphics, web and animation.

applications.editors: Sometimes called text editors, these are programs that allow you to create and edit text files. This includes Emacs and Vi.

applications.engineering-and-scientific: This group includes packages for performing mathematical and scientific computations and plotting, as well as unit conversion.

applications.font-design: This group is a collection of tools used in the design, modification, manipulation, and packaging of fonts.

applications.games: Various ways to relax and spend your free time.

applications.graphical-internet: This group includes graphical email, web, and chat clients.

applications.graphics: This group includes packages to help you manipulate and scan images.

applications.medical: This is a group of applications related to health care.

applications.office: The applications include office suites, PDF viewers, and more.

applications.sound-and-video: From CD recording to playing audio CDs and multimedia files, this package group allows you to work with sound and video on the system.

applications.text-internet: This group includes text-based email, web, and chat clients. These applications do not require the X Window System.

lxde-desktop.lxde-apps: A set of commonly used applications for the LXDE Desktop

lxde-desktop.lxde-desktop: LXDE is a lightweight X11 desktop environment designed for computers with low hardware specifications like netbooks, mobile devices or older computers.

sugar-desktop-environment.sugar-apps: Additional activities for use with the Sugar Environment.

sugar-desktop-environment.sugar-desktop: A software playground for learning about learning.

xfce-desktop.xfce-apps: A set of commonly used applications for the Xfce Desktop

xfce-desktop.xfce-desktop: A lightweight desktop environment that works well on low end machines.

xfce-desktop.xfce-extra-plugins: Extend the functionality of the Xfce panel

base-system.admin-tools: This group is a collection of graphical administration tools for the system, such as for managing user accounts and configuring system hardware.

base-system.fonts: Fonts packages for rendering text on the desktop.

base-system.hardware-support: This group is a collection of tools for various hardware specific utilities.

base-system.input-methods: Input method packages for the input of international text.

base-system.java: Support for running programs written in the Java programming language.

base-system.legacy-fonts: Older bitmap and vector fonts packages

base-system.networkmanager-submodules: This group contains NetworkManager submodules that are commonly used, but may not be wanted in some streamlined configurations.

base-system.standard: Common set of utilities that extend the minimal installation.

base-system.system-tools: This group is a collection of various tools for the system, such as the client for connecting to SMB shares and tools to monitor network traffic.

base-system.virtualization: These packages provide a graphical virtualization environment.
